solution_line_template: The two regular scoops cost ${cost_regular_scoop} x {num_regular_scoops} = $<<{cost_regular_scoop}*{num_regular_scoops}={cost_total_regular}>>{cost_total_regular}.
The two kiddie scoops cost ${cost_kiddie_scoop} x {num_kiddie_scoops} = $<<{cost_kiddie_scoop}*{num_kiddie_scoops}={cost_total_kiddie}>>{cost_total_kiddie}.
The three double scoops cost ${cost_double_scoop} x {num_double_scoops} = $<<{cost_double_scoop}*{num_double_scoops}={cost_total_double}>>{cost_total_double}.

For all the ice creams they ordered, Mrs. Martin pays ${cost_total_regular} + ${cost_total_kiddie} + ${cost_total_double} = $<<{cost_total_regular}+{cost_total_kiddie}+{cost_total_double}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
